result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

09:33 AM Defendant Elijah J Grenada in court, in custody, with attorney Pablo Galaviz.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim B appeared by Zoom with Victim/Witness specialist Jessica Hernandez who appeared by Zoom.    All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Detective Richard Tank, of the City of Brookfield Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Nickolie.
No Cross examination.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
The State provides the Defense with discovery.
Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Atty. Pablo Galaviz

Status conference on June 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 6, 2022 at 09:15 am.

01:43 PM Defendant Elijah J Grenada in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
Attorney Menden states he does qualify, however they must find outside counsel to accept the case.
The Court notes that the SPD filed a report stating the contact with outside counsel and goes over that report.
The Defendant states he is on a P&P hold and has yet to speak with his agent.
The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defendant as to tolling the time limits to have an attorney appointed to his case.
The Defendant states he would like an attorney be appointed before going to a prelim. 
The Court finds good cause to toll the time limits at this time.
The Court takes the prelim hearing scheduled on 05/27/2022 off the calendar.
The Court will set a new prelim hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 09:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Request for zoom link
  **Reviewed by Commissioner David Herring on 05-26-2022. Granted
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

Status conference on May 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 27, 2022 at 10:15 am.

02:09 PM Defendant Elijah J Grenada in court, in custody, with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim B appeared by zoom with Victim Witness Specialist by zoom.  Attorney Miller states the defendant does not qualify for the representation.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed but attorney Miller states there is a conflict with their office and they need to appoint counsel outside their office.  The defendant does not wish to waive the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Court conducts colloquy with Attorney Miller in regards to the delay in appointing counsel.  Court takes recess at 2:17 pm so attorney Miller may contact her office.  Case recalled at 2:33 pm with the same appearances.  The Court inquires of attorney Miller how many contacts the public defenders office has made in regards to counsel.  Attorney Miller states they have had four contacts with other attorneys and are in the process of obtaining counsel for the defendant.  The Court places findings on the record.  The Court finds good cause to adjourn the preliminary hearing so the defendant may have counsel and has all his rights provided to him.  Court adjourns the preliminary hearing set for tomorrow and will adjourn to next week.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to have no contact with victims A-E/co-actor (Deterrion Dunbar) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.   The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.   Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.   Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.
